istoricPage.intro: The Municipality of Salonta, the second most populous in Bihor County after Oradea, is located in the westernmost part of the country, near the border with Hungary. The natural conditions specific to the plain area have favored the existence of human settlements since ancient times.
istoricPage.firstAttestation: The first documentary attestation of Salonta dates from 1332 when, in a papal document, the settlement is called "Socerdas de Ville Zalantha". Subsequently, the name of the locality underwent several changes, until it reached the form "Szalonta" in 1587.
istoricPage.toldiPeriod: Until the 16th century, Salonta belonged to the Toldi noble family and had no great importance in the area, mainly due to its location near Culișer Fortress, a strong political-economic center that was raised to the rank of city in the 12th century. During this period, the village of Salonta comprised approximately 50 houses set among swamps and reeds, with about 250-300 inhabitants.
istoricPage.bocskaiCaption: The Prince of Transylvania, Stephanus Bocskai
istoricPage.turkishDestruction: The Turks destroyed both Culișer Fortress and old Salonta in 1598. The fortress was not repopulated, but after a short period of time, Salonta recovered. This was due to the return of part of the refugee population and the settlement here, by order of the Prince of Transylvania, Bocskai István, of three hundred free soldiers whose task was to defend the border regions against the Turks.
istoricPage.watchtower: During the same period, the watchtower in the center of the settlement was built, known today as the "Csonka Tower", which served as an observation post. The soldiers of Salonta received significant land areas and enjoyed privileges that were later increased through the granting of noble titles.
istoricPage.privileges: The privileges and freedoms granted to the inhabitants led to the numerical growth of the city's population and its transformation into a strong economic center, especially following the right to organize fairs.
istoricPage.tradeGrowth: Because the city is located at the edge of the Principality of Transylvania and near the territories dominated by the Turks, merchants from Transylvania met those from the Ottoman occupation zone at the Salonta Fair. The intense exchange of goods led to the rapid development of the settlement and the emergence of small industry: leather tanning, sandal making, boot making, fur making, weaving, and blacksmithing.
istoricPage.tradeFairs: The produced goods met local needs and were also sold at eastern and southern fairs in Tinca, Beiuș, Ineu, Chișineu Criș and at fairs in the Ottoman occupation zone, at Gyula and Orosháza.
istoricPage.rakoczi: In 1659, the Prince of Transylvania, Rákóczi György II, ordered the burning of the city, which began to be repopulated only at the end of the 17th century. As a result of successes against the Turks, Austria gained control of Hungary from 1686 and Transylvania from 1688.
istoricPage.leopoldPrivileges: Emperor Leopold strengthened the privileges of Salonta's inhabitants, but in 1700 the Imperial Court renounced the military services of the free soldiers and canceled their privileges. This led to disagreements between the inhabitants of Salonta and the Eszterházy noble family, a process that was resolved in the revolutionary year 1848.
istoricPage.revolution1848: During the Revolution of 1848, the poet Arany János distinguished himself through his activity. His verses reflect the poet's participation in the events.
istoricPage.guilds: After a brief period of freedom, the territory of Salonta was reintegrated into the Habsburg Empire under an absolutist regime. At the beginning of the 19th century, craftsmen organized themselves into guilds. The first guild, that of bootmakers, was established in 1820, and that of tanners in 1836. In 1872, craftsmen, with the exception of bootmakers, formed the Mixed Union of Craftsmen. At the end of the 19th century, nearly 500 masters with operating licenses were registered.
istoricPage.historicalImageCaption: Salonta at the turn of the 19th and 20th centuries
istoricPage.modernization: At the turn of the 19th and 20th centuries, the region developed intensively. During this period, swamp drainage works began, the railway line was built, and the first capitalist institutions in industry and commerce appeared. There was also a strong influx of rural population to the city.
istoricPage.borderCity: The movement of European peoples for self-determination following World War I led to the dissolution of the Habsburg Empire and the formation of nation states. Under the new conditions, Salonta became one of the border points between Romania and Hungary.
istoricPage.industrialGrowth: The city's industrial development intensified after 1948 through the establishment of new economic units. Salonta thus became a city with a continuously developing industrial-agrarian economy.
istoricPage.industries: The food industry, textile, clothing, leather, fur and footwear industries, as well as wood processing, are industrial branches with old traditions in the area and currently account for 65% of the city's global production, with the food industry being dominant. Alongside these, the machine-building industry has appeared and developed.
istoricPage.touristAttractions: Visitors to Salonta can stop at the houses that belonged to poets Arany János, Sinka István, and Zilahy Lajos, lay a flower at their statues or that of the 1848 revolutionary Kossuth Lajos, or admire the Csonka Tower or the "Arany" Palace which houses the "Teodor Neș" Municipal Library and an art gallery. The city's churches and the Town Hall building are also worth visiting.
istoricPage.opportunities: Leaving behind the city's tourist attractions, Salonta can be a starting point for hunting and fishing enthusiasts. At the same time, Salonta offers multiple opportunities for interested investors and businesspeople, being a city of all possibilities.

oraseInfratitePage.intro: The Municipality of Salonta maintains twinning and cooperation relationships with cities in Hungary and Slovakia, promoting cultural and economic exchanges.
oraseInfratitePage.aboutText: City twinning represents a form of cooperation that promotes cultural, economic, and social exchanges between communities. These partnerships facilitate joint projects, experience sharing, and strengthen ties between peoples.

culturaPage.intro: The city of Salonta has given universal culture numerous personalities:

personalities.foldiJanos: Földi János (1755-1801) enlightenment scholar, scientist, naturalist, linguist and physician
personalities.lovassyLaszlo: Lovassy László (1844-1898) writer, translator, ethnographer, folklorist
personalities.sinkaIstvan: Sinka István (1897-1969) poet and prose writer
personalities.teodorNes: Teodor Neș from Mădăras (1891-1975) pedagogue, publicist, eminent politician

culturaPage.museumIntro: The most representative was the activity of the poet Arany János. As a reward for his merits in the socio-cultural field, the museum bears his name. The "Arany János" Memorial Museum is housed in the oldest building in the city, the only medieval construction, declared a historical monument and visited by over 10,000 tourists annually.
culturaPage.aranyJanosBio1: He was born in Salonta in 1817, being the tenth child of a poor family; of the ten siblings, only two survived. This tragedy led the parents to take special care of the education of their youngest child.
culturaPage.aranyJanosBio2: He completed ten grades in Salonta, after which he continued his studies in Debrecen. Due to financial difficulties, he had to work from a young age. He could not complete his studies at the Debrecen college.
culturaPage.aranyJanosBio3: For a while he was an actor in a theater company with which he traveled through the country. He settled in Salonta, living from a modest position as deputy notary. He got married and led a quiet life. The notary position helped him know social life, which is critically exposed in the work Az elveszett alkotmány (The Lost Constitution), for which he won an award from the Kisfaludy Society.
culturaPage.aranyJanosBio4: His first masterpiece is the work Toldi. Through the publication of this poetic story, Arany became known, valued, and considered by all readers of his people as a great national poet. He also gained the friendship of Petőfi, who enthusiastically congratulated him through a poem.
culturaPage.aranyJanosBio5: During the revolution of 1848, he was an enthusiastic tribune alongside Petőfi. In the 1850s, he arrived in Nagykőrös, where the poet wrote his first ballads.
culturaPage.aranyJanosBio6: He left Nagykőrös and in 1860 settled in Budapest. He dedicated himself to literary activity, but wasted much time in administrative positions; he was also secretary of the Hungarian Academy.
culturaPage.aranyJanosBio7: He passed away in Budapest in 1882.
culturaPage.culturalEventsIntro: The Municipality of Salonta hosts numerous cultural events annually that celebrate the city's diversity and cultural heritage:
culturaPage.event1: Salonta City Days - annual festival with concerts, shows and cultural activities
culturaPage.event2: Arany János Festival - event dedicated to the poet Arany János
culturaPage.event3: Traditional celebrations - events celebrating Romanian and Hungarian traditions
culturaPage.event4: Art exhibitions - displays of local and national artists' works

economiePage.intro: Salonta's economy is based on a balanced mix of agriculture, industry, commerce and services, leveraging its strategic geographic position at the border with Hungary.

agriculture.title: Agriculture
agriculture.description: The agricultural sector is an important component of the local economy, with cereal and vegetable production and animal husbandry.

industry.title: Industry
industry.description: Manufacturing industry, especially in food and construction, contributes to economic development.

commerce.title: Commerce and Services
commerce.description: The commercial and services sector has developed significantly, offering diverse opportunities for business and employment.

tourism.title: Tourism
tourism.description: Cultural tourism, based on Arany János heritage and local traditions, attracts visitors from Romania and Hungary.

economiePage.borderCrossingText: Due to the city's favorable geographic location, in 1996 the Border Crossing Point to Hungary 'Salonta – Méhkerék' was opened, 14 km from the city, accessible via a modernized asphalt road.
economiePage.industrialZoneUtilities: The industrial zone is equipped with the following utilities: natural gas, national road access, sewerage, drinking and industrial water, electricity, telephone network.
economiePage.industrialActivityText: Industrial activity is predominantly concentrated in the northwestern part of the city, as shown in the General Urban Plan, specifically in Territorial Reference Unit No. 1, located within the municipality's built-up area. Near this zone is the Salonta CFR Halt, enabling passenger and freight transport by rail.
economiePage.mainFunctionsText: The main functions of Salonta city are characterized by the following activities: industrial, agricultural, service, socio-cultural and commercial, passenger and freight transport, administrative-coordination.
economiePage.industrialDevelopmentText: The development of industrial production in this city was contributed to by the development of crafts, the presence of workforce, and the favorable geographic position. The municipality of Salonta has a highly qualified workforce in all fields.
economiePage.mainIndustriesText: Among the main industrial branches we mention: food industry, machine building, textiles, clothing, leather, fur, footwear, and wood processing.

economiePage.investmentText1: For potential investors, approximately 20 hectares would be available within the city limits. To provide developed land to potential investors, Salonta Local Council is studying the possibility of developing an industrial area, in accordance with current legislation, on 10 hectares of private city property, free of encumbrances, intended for industrial activity.
economiePage.investmentText2: In addition to the advantages of locations intended for potential investors, the Local Council, in accordance with current legislation, may grant various tax incentives based on certain criteria.
economiePage.investmentText3: An important element for investors is the proximity to the border.

generalePage.ghidulCetateanului: Citizen's Guide - Transparency in Public Administration
generalePage.ceLegea52Desc: The transparency law ensures the openness of public administration activity towards citizens through two important mechanisms:
generalePage.ceLegea52Item1: Your participation in the process of drafting normative regulations
generalePage.ceLegea52Item2: Your participation in the decision-making process
generalePage.cuiSeAdreseazaDesc: The transparency law involves collaboration between two partners: public administration and the recipients of regulations developed by it (citizens, non-governmental organizations, business associations).
generalePage.cePresupuneDesc1: We are obliged to make public draft normative regulations before they are adopted.
generalePage.cePresupuneDesc2: After this moment, if you are interested, you have the opportunity to formulate suggestions and recommendations regarding the regulations presented in draft form.
generalePage.avantajeTitle: What are the advantages of applying this law for you?
generalePage.avantajeItem1: You are informed about proposed normative draft regulations to be adopted
generalePage.avantajeItem2: It encourages you to express your views on these projects and thus get involved in solving community problems
generalePage.proceduraDesc1: We publish an announcement informing you that a certain draft decision with public character has been initiated and requesting you to express your opinions, proposals, suggestions in writing, the deadline for submission, as well as the place where related materials can be studied.
generalePage.proceduraDesc2: Legally constituted associations may request the organization of public debates on the draft decision, and we will communicate the date, time and place where the debate will take place (within maximum 10 days of the request).
generalePage.proceduraDesc3: Proposals and suggestions will be analyzed by the initiator and local council, they have a recommendation character, the decision to include them in the final decision belongs to the public authority.
generalePage.contestareDesc: The methods of contesting the decision of the authority or public institution in the situation where the person considers himself/herself harmed regarding the right of access to requested public interest information are provided in art. 21 and 22 of Law no. 544/2001:
generalePage.contestareItem1: Administrative complaint – to be submitted to the head of the authority or public institution
generalePage.contestareItem2: Complaint to the administrative litigation section of the court in whose territorial jurisdiction the person resides or in whose territorial jurisdiction the headquarters of the authority or public institution is located
generalePage.contestareNote: The methods of contesting the authority's decision in the situation where the person considers himself/herself harmed by an administrative act are provided by Law 554/2004 on administrative litigation.
